definition: fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
pinyin: feng1 yan1 si4 qi3 , zhan4 huo3 fen1 fei1

sentences.english: Will not make any people see wars in the world.
sentences.chinese: 不让人们看见战火纷飞的世界。

sentences.english: Vladimir Radmanovic was born into civil war in the former Yugoslavia.
sentences.chinese: 拉马出生在南斯拉夫战火纷飞的年代。

sentences.english: There are jungles and military clashes. She is the only Chinese woman there.
sentences.chinese: 那块土地战火纷飞，她是唯一的中国女性。

definition: cannon firing for days on end (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
fire beacons on all sides (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
soldiers munity and troops rebel (idiom); turmoil and chaos of war
fire beacon (used as alarm signal over long distance)
the fire of war in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
